topicTitle: What is your favorite nostalgic game?

posts.postText: Mine is Sonic Adventure 2 Battle, that was the only game me and my brothers played for years, I easily put 1000-2000 hours into the Chao garden, I had the best Chao in school. Until I sent my Chao away to see what would happen, never played game again.

Console:Goldeneye, I still play it when ever my brother from Georgetown comes over for something. Funnest game ever.
Handheld: Pokemon Red and Blue: Almost 9 years of just playing it. Fun with the missingno glitch, About 700 hours on each of them.
Sonic 2 adventure battle was great but I loved pikmen with passion, I actually got sad when my little pikmen died

Super Mario 64, the original smash bros, james bond: agent under fire (the multiplayer)
sonic adventure 2 battle as well. Maybe even LOZ: WW

Fucking Halo 2 on the original Xbox Live.

I picked up that shit right when I got into Junior High. It was really the first ever gaming online experience I've had, and I still feel it was the best. Such a simple game, yet tons and tons of fun. I seriously get pretty depressed when I think about all the memories I have, and all the friends I made. Sucks that Microsoft shut down all the original Live games, and still hasn't extended the Friend's List limit. 

R.I.P Halo 2
Starcraft, Halo 1, and Super Smash Bros, that pretty much sums up my childhood right there.

Anything Gamecube/N64
 (OoT, Mario 64, DonkeyKong 64, Super Mario sunshine, Pikmin, Pikmin 2, SSB, SSBM, Sonic Adventure 2 Battle FTW. Pikmin will last FOREVER) 
Oh and to NBLCKK, Its "Pikmin" And they are making Pikmin 3.

>> Fucking Halo 2 on the original Xbox Live.

R.I.P Halo 2 This. I also have tons of memories from that game, it truely was much much more than just an "Alien shooting game". The community was fantastic, I miss playing on LIVE very much.
